intro: Cylindrolobus biflorus, commonly known as the two-flowered cylinder lobe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Cylindrolobus biflorus is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
